alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds from showers and remnant thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Salt Lake...southwestern Davis and central Tooele Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 614 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow winds along a line extending from near Tooele Army Depot to 12 miles northwest of Dugway Proving Ground Test Range. Movement was northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tooele, Grantsville, Stansbury Park, Delle, Tooele Army Depot, Clive, Skull Valley, Utah Test and Training Range South, Knolls, Dugway Proving Ground Test Range, Great Salt Lake South of the Causeway, Stockton, Rush Valley, Erda and Lake Point. This includes Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 17 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys
